definition: to be at a loss for words/speechless
dialect/language/speech
to tell to
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
strategic pass/tactical border position

to stop up/to stuff/to cope with

sentences.english: I'm serious. I avoided her question.
sentences.chinese: 我語塞，支支吾吾地迴避了她的問題。

sentences.english: The sight of his former wife dumbed the words in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他一看見他的前妻，頓時感到語塞，說不出話來。

sentences.english: Their opponents were shut up by their argument.
sentences.chinese: 他們的爭論使對手爲之語塞。

sentences.english: Shocked and scared, I could not conjure up the courage to speak.
sentences.chinese: 又驚又怕的我竟一時語塞，沒有勇氣開口說話。

sentences.english: The given reason seemed very rational, which made my wife's tongue tied.
sentences.chinese: 這理由似乎很充分，老婆一時語塞。

definition: red in the face/extremely angry
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to force someone to do something
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster

vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in

to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble

sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
